author: agarof
message:
Fix CONFIG_LITTLEFS_USE_ONLY_HASH with recent esp-idf

Currently, having CONFIG_LITTLEGS_USE_ONLY_HASH set to `y` breaks the
build when using esp-idf >= v4.4.2.

author: Brian Pugh
message:
Pass CONFIG_LITTLEFS_OBJ_NAME_LEN to the mklittlefs build command (#79)

* Pass CONFIG_LITTLEFS_OBJ_NAME_LEN to the mklittlefs build command

* fix stray typo

* According to lfs.h, LFS_NAME_MAX caps out at 1022

* set LFS_NAME_MAX envvar for mklittlefs compilation

* update LITTLEFS_OBJ_NAME kconfig doc

* rebuild mklittlefs if sdkconfig changes

author: wang33_winner
message: fix the bug: if LITTLEFS_SDMMC_SUPPORT turns on, some features are problematic when using flash.

author: Erik Fleckstein
message:
Fix LITTLEFS_MALLOC_STRATEGY_SPIRAM depends.

ESP32_SPIRAM_SUPPORT has been renamed to SPIRAM since IDF 5.0:
https://github.com/espressif/esp-idf/commit/0687daf2c85b916fa0a17a29a950b4eb938cc12a#diff-23044c90e9c0d809dc2befbe42491cd077bf06445cd24e6acba7784ea5f28b27R20

Also checking for SPIRAM support is not necessary, as SPIRAM_USE_MALLOC
already depends on SPIRAM.

Additionally allocating using heap_caps_malloc(..., MALLOC_CAP_SPIRAM)
is also possible if SPIRAM_USE_CAPS_ALLOC is set (then SPIRAM is
**only** allocatable with heap_caps_malloc, not with malloc)
